intro: Landolphia letestui, commonly known as the African star apple, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant produces bright red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and edible fruits, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and for local consumption.
